content.question: Directions: The suggested time is about 15 minutes for the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Show all your work for each part of the question. 2. The variable x represents the position of particle A in a two-particle system. Particle B remains at rest. The above graph shows the potential energy <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>U</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyvaiaacI cacaWG4bGaaiykaaaa@3926@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> of the system as a function of position x of particle A, which has a mass of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>0</mtext> <mtext>.40 kg</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeimaiaab6 cacaqG0aGaaeimaiaabccacaqGRbGaae4zaaaa@3B3F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Particle A is released from rest at the position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaikdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Assume positive to be toward the right. (a) Calculate the speed of particle A when it reaches position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>14.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaigdacaaI0aGaaiOlaiaaicdacaqGGaGaaeyBaaaa@3C71@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text: Directions: The suggested time is about 15 minutes for the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. Show all your work for each part of the question. 2. The variable x represents the position of particle A in a two-particle system. Particle B remains at rest. The above graph shows the potential energy <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>U</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyvaiaacI cacaWG4bGaaiykaaaa@3926@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> of the system as a function of position x of particle A, which has a mass of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mtext>0</mtext> <mtext>.40 kg</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeimaiaab6 cacaqG0aGaaeimaiaabccacaqGRbGaae4zaaaa@3B3F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Particle A is released from rest at the position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaikdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. Assume positive to be toward the right. (a) Calculate the speed of particle A when it reaches position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>14.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaigdacaaI0aGaaiOlaiaaicdacaqGGaGaaeyBaaaa@3C71@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(b) i. Calculate the magnitude of the acceleration of particle A when it reaches position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiodacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB5@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

ii. What is the direction of the acceleration of particle A when it reaches position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiodacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB5@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> ? ____Left ____Right

(c) Determine the magnitude of the acceleration of particle A when it reaches position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>7.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiEdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB9@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(d) Particle A is again released from rest at the position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaikdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. i. Calculate the elapsed time for particle A to travel from position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaikdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> to position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiAdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB8@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

ii. Calculate the elapsed time for particle A to travel from position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiAdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB8@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> to position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>8.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiIdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BBA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

iii. Calculate the elapsed time for particle A to travel from position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>8.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiIdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BBA@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> to position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>14</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaigdacaaI0aGaaeiiaiaab2gaaaa@3B05@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(e) Particle A is now placed at position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>7.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiEdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB9@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. In order for particle A to reach the position <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>16.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaigdacaaI2aGaaiOlaiaaicdacaqGGaGaaeyBaaaa@3C73@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> and to be moving at a speed of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1.0</mn> <mtext> </mtext> <mrow> <mtext>m</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <mtext>s</mtext> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGymaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaeiiamaalyaabaGaaeyBaaqaaiaabohaaaaaaa@3ABC@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, what initial speed should particle A be given at its new initial position of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>7.0</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9iaaiEdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3BB9@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> ?

(f) On the grid below, carefully draw a graph of the force F acting on particle A as a function of x for the range <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>16</mn> <mtext> m</mtext> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgY da8iaadIhacqGH8aapcaaIXaGaaGOnaiaabccacaqGTbaaaa@3CC3@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

skill.text: 1.B: Create quantitative graphs with appropriate scales and units, including plotting data.
